ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.
A Seating_plane is a type of included specifically for the purpose of providing a description of an interface plane. One primary usage in that purpose is synchronizing the two-dimensional and three-dimensional models of a package. The seating plane simulates a mating feature when referenced as an interface_plane. The seating plane simulates the interconnect substrate surface in the definition view of a package, where it is referenced in the role of a package_seating_plane or die_seating_plane. When represented by a three-dimensional plane the normal shall represent the mating surface. The normal vector shall be in the Z axis and shall be at the origin of the defining coordinate system for the three-dimensional case. A Seating_plane scope shall be a , or a .

A Non_feature_shape_element is a type of that is not on the physical boundary of a . A Non_feature_shape_element may be one of a , a , a , a , a . A Non_feature_shape_element may be a , and may additionally be one of a , a , a . A Non_feature_shape_element may be one of a , a , a , a , an , a , a , or a . An Express representation of this type description is found in the Note below and shall be used for implementation purposes.

the associated_usage_concept is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Non_feature_shape_element is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Non_feature_shape_element as its . There shall be zero or more for a Non_feature_shape_element.

the element_shape is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Non_feature_shape_element is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Non_feature_shape_element as its . There shall be zero or more for a Non_feature_shape_element.
the scope specifies the for the Non_feature_shape_element. The scope may specify the role of a , a , a , a , or a for the Non_feature_shape_element.
A Non_feature_shape_element_relationship is a type of that associates a with a from which the is derived.

A Non_feature_shape_definition is a type of . A Non_feature_shape_definition may be one of a , or a , or a , or a , or a , or a , or a . A Non_feature_shape_definition may also be one of a , or a . A Non_feature_shape_definition shall be used to represent annotation information or other shape property information that is not appropriate for .
Shape information that is derived from a physical shape and whose algorithmic derivation details are unavailable may be exchanged with this Application Object.
the model_shape specifies the role of the for the Non_feature_shape_definition. The model_shape need not be supplied.
the associated_element specifies the role of the for the Non_feature_shape_definition.

A Reference_graphic_registration_mark is a type of that is annotation graphic included in the design model for a pcb. A set of Reference_graphic_registration_mark is used to visually indicate a reference alignment for tooling purposes. The geometric representation for a Reference_graphic_registration_mark is identical to the geometric representation of the for a product that is a tool, usually a phototool.
The difference between a Reference_graphic_registration_mark and a is that the Reference_graphic_registration_mark is annotation and therefore is not to be operated on as part of the design geometric model wheras the is a real feature of the tool model and is operated on as part of the tool geometric model.
Reference_graphic_registration_marks are included for complete CAD to CAD data exchange purposes since many 2D CAD applications include geometry representing these tooling marks as part of the standard CAD file output.

A Non_feature_shape_composition_relationship is a type of . A Non_feature_shape_composition_relationship is the association of a with its to create a resultant . In the case where the placement is not supplied, both Non_feature_shape_definitions are in the same geometric context.
A Non_feature_shape_composition_relationship is included to support composition of Non_feature and non-physical shapes. Component_2d_location and other types of location Application Objects support composition of assembly or interconnect shapes. Usage_concept_usage_view_relationship supports composition of shapes in the usage view. The name is generic to support extensibility. Mirroring is possible by use of Cartesian_transformation_operator. The use of mirroring should be carefully considered toavoid confusion in receiving systems.
A Non_feature_shape_composition_relationship would be used to transform a keepout shape for a detail into an overall keepout shape. It may be that the detail shape is a .
the resultant_feature_shape specifies one role of the for the Non_feature_shape_composition_relationship. This role name is redeclared from the shape_1 attribute inherited from .
the related_feature_shape specifies one role of the for the Feature_shape_composition_relationship. This role name is redeclared from the shape_2 attribute inherited from .
the related_feature_shape_placement specifies the role of the or of the for the Non_feature_shape_composition_relationship. The related_feature_shape_placement is optional and need not be supplied.

A View_level_non_feature_shape_definition is a type of .
the model_shape specifies the role of the for the View_level_non_feature_shape_definition.
